articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: All flights from the airport are cancelled as emergency services respond to the incident.
articles.title: Plane crashes at London Southend Airport in Essex

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: Sunday will see possible highs of 31C before a slight dip that will bring a cooler change next week, the Met Office says.
articles.title: Hot weather continues as UK swelters past heatwave peak

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: Kyiv says two people accused of working for Russia and shooting dead a Ukrainian intelligence officer were killed.
articles.title: Russia's agents killed after intelligence officer shot dead, says Ukraine

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: It is thought 17 children have been treated at the Liverpool hospital for the virus since June.
articles.title: Child dies at Alder Hey Children's hospital as measles cases surge

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: The death came hours after a 63-year-old woman died near a waterfall at Campsie Glen in East Dunbartonshire.
articles.title: Boy, 15, dies in river incident in Glasgow on hottest day

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: The camp where 27 girls died successfully challenged initial risk designations by US regulators, according to reports.
articles.title: Camp Mystic buildings were removed from flood map, US media reports

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: Heidi Alexander says she will announce measures to cut the cost of buying an electric car.
articles.title: Electric car purchases will be cheaper, pledges Heidi Alexander

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: Iran's Fars news agency says President Masoud Pezeshkian had a leg injury when his secret site was hit in June.
articles.title: Iran President Pezeshkian was reportedly injured in Israeli strikes

articles.author: BBC News
articles.description: The Israeli military has not yet commented on the strike, which witnesses said hit a crowd queuing to get water at a refugee camp.
articles.title: Children fetching water killed in Israeli strike in Gaza, emergency officials say

articles.author: BBC Sport
articles.description: Tributes have been paid to Diogo Jota and his brother Andre Silva ahead of Liverpool's first match since they died in a car crash.
articles.title: Diogo Jota: Liverpool pay tribute to forward in first match since his death
